newsitem.title: USA: North America bunkers steady to firmer with crude.
newsitem.headline: North America bunkers steady to firmer with crude.

text.p: North American bunker prices were steady to firmer Thursday, lifted by higher crude values and perceptions of increased near-term demand.
"There are rumors of a big export tender that could move demand into the fuel market," one New York trader said.
He said the deal could form within a couple of months and keep prices firm meanwhile.
NYMEX October crude settled 58 cents higher at $22.30 a barrel in late New York trade Thursday.
New York Harbor 380 CST was talked between $109 and $110 a tonne, flat from values quoted Tuesday.
180 CST was assessed unchanged at $114/115, players said.
Houston 380 CST edged up $3 to $99/100, traders said, while 180 CST rose $1 to $101/103.
Traders reported a mixed bag on the West Coast, with Los Angeles 380 CST firming about $2 to $92/95, and Seattle bids for the product slipping by $1 to $95.
Weak demand in the region offset firm Far East values, traders said.
